I feel like 666 hours is a perfect time to review this cursed game....
This game starts out fun and slowly becomes more repetitive, the community becomes more toxic, and the devs care less and less about what they release. After 4 years there are still problems and game breaking bugs in each update that get left unfixed. As awful as everything i just said sounds i still find myself playing on a normal occasion and is currently why i am recommending this game still. Definitely give this game a try if you can grab it on sale as it will vent you a couple hundred hours of fun if you like hunter / killer games.

[h1]This is one of the most unique games i've played, and is still fun enough to keep me playing even today[/h1]
[u]before i get to my review, if you are going to buy this thinking its a horror game, don't.[/u] It is a horror [i]themed[/i] game. the fact that it is multiplayer and the killer is controlled by a player alone guarantees that after a little experience with the game it won't be scary. that being said though, it is truly my favourite multiplayer game.
         so many multiplayer games feel so similar, with the most popular being fps games that have only small diferences from any other cod clone fps. because of this I was bored of multiplayer games and only ever played singleplayer games with the exception of overwatch and tf2. then i discovered this game. it's asymetricality alone intrigued me, and the core gameplay was so different from any other game i'd played, whilst still maintaining a focus on mechanichal and tactical skill. the simple core of the gameplay means it is easy(ish) to learn and hard to master. the ranks and charachter progression through the bloodweb gives you clear goals to work towards, which helps make you feel like your time in the game is worth something. the variety of perks, addons, and killer powers (for killer), makes it so that there are several playstyles, and with new killers and survivors with perks of their own keeps gameplay from getting stale. more powerfull items and addons can be fun to use once in a while, though they are often annoying for the other side so i suggest you don't use them often [spoiler] looking at you keys/moris/iri head [/spoiler]
               people often complain about the balance of the game, though I don't find it to be too unbalanced that it isn't fun, and so that isnt much of an issue to me. my biggest issue is that the game itself doesn't do a great job of telling you the fundamentals of how the game truly works, which in my case made it harder to get into. watching youtube videos can help out a lot with this, but i feel i should give a summary of how chases usually work. in case if anyone would rather learn this on their own I will mark it as a spoiler. keep in mind I'm a killer main so take anything I say about survivor with a grain of salt.


       [spoiler] while to the untrained eye the map can seem chaotic and random, someone more experienced will know that the map is comprised of what is known as loops. a loop consists of a window or pallet, with walls or objects around it. these can sometimes have several walls, windows, or pallets. survivor must learn how to identify loops and how to maximize their rescource efficiency, whilst the killer must learn how to take advantage of their power and the survivor's limited knowledge to shorten time at loops, and thus shorten chases in general. usually at a loop a survivor will run around the loop and vault a window or pallet when the killer gets close, taking advantage of their slower vault and pallet breaking speeds, whilst the killer will try to predict the survivor's movement and be mindfull of what information the survivor has as to their location in order to get within lunge distance of the survivor before they can vault a window or drop a pallet. [b] AS THE SURVIVOR, YOU ARE NOT TRYING TO ESCAPE THE CHASE, YOU ARE TRYING TO MAKE IT LAST AS LONG AS POSSIBLE SO GENERATORS CAN BE COMPLETED. AS KILLER YOU ARE TRYING TO DOWN THE SURVIVOR AS QUICKLY AS POSSIBLE SO YOU CAN PRESSURE THE OTHER SURVIVOR'S AND SLOW GENERATOR PROGRESS. [/b] those are the two most important points. in a way this game can be summarized like this, the killer is in a race against the clock, and the survivor's are trying to keep that clock ticking quickly. [/spoiler]

Juego muy divertido, presenta un ambiente terrorifico, aunque muy similares. Es un juego que busca fortalecer el trabajo en equipo, por lo tanto promueve la comunicación. Ideal para llevarse unos buenos sustos, sobre todo con la gran variedad de personajes que tiene para elegir, además está permitido el crossplay lo que admite la versátilidad de conección con usuarios de otras plataformas.

Dead by Daylight has a bunch of ups and downs for both killers and survivors but it’s just how they have made it.

It’s never going to be balance but yes some of the buffs and nerfs have been very bad or at least unbalanced from a stand point, Fact.
un juego perfecto si te molan las motosierras

I love this game but I wish we couldn't play with console players. i feel like the toxicity in the game is worse now that we are able to play with console gamers. Not saying they are the only ones that do this but the constant face camping and tunneling makes it shit ti play this game. Some console gamers are cool but for the most part not so much. Not only that whats the point of playing a game where anyone can dc and not get punished? if u dont care about all of that then u'll enjoy the game.

02/03/21 - It's gotten worse since the update. More ppl have started tunnel/face/proxy/slugging. They are over using certain abilities that pretty much make this game a piece of garbage but hey i still play it. More bc of the ppl I play with and not the game itself. I do find rare ppl who will actually play the game as it should and not as cheap as most ppl play it. If you need to tunnel/face camp/proxy camp/slug then u def shouldnt feel proud of yourself. u might as well be a hacker. u play like one.

06/21/21 - I feel like this game has gotten worse. Even more tunneling just to get the killer 1 person at a time. and on top of that they are giving more perks that make killers easier to use or faster to kill survivors. Why keep nerfing survivors when you need to nerf killers. the funny thing is my friend got tunnelled 4 times in a row game after game after game.... yet this is okay... but when a survivor has bt/ds/key then the killers get to cry about it and get buffed. i dont understand this game has become shit

I like the balance between the survivors and the killers. Definitely a game to play with friends, but super enjoyable and a little more tense (if not slightly frustrating) when matchmaking with complete strangers.

This game is a lot of fun when you get non-toxic players. Sometimes matches go your way, sometimes they don't, and sometimes matches that seem like everyone will die take a 180 degree turn and everyone escapes. The results are always different, you never know what killer you'll be up against. 9/10, wonderful game.
